questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Which number is missing from this sequence? 750, 725, 700, ___, 625

content_zh.stem: Which number is missing from this sequence? 750, 725, 700, ___, 625

questions.explanation_en: The pattern decreases by 25 each time: 750, 725, 700, 675, 650. The missing number is 675.
questions.explanation_zh: The pattern decreases by 25 each time: 750, 725, 700, 675, 650. The missing number is 675.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-001 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Mary needs eggs for cake dough. How many eggs does she need?

content_zh.stem: Mary needs eggs for cake dough. How many eggs does she need?

questions.explanation_en: Based on the recipe proportions, Mary needs 18 eggs.
questions.explanation_zh: Based on the recipe proportions, Mary needs 18 eggs.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-002 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Which picture shows 1/3 of a region shaded?

content_zh.stem: Which picture shows 1/3 of a region shaded?

questions.explanation_en: 1/3 means the shape is divided into 3 equal parts and 1 part is shaded.
questions.explanation_zh: 1/3 means the shape is divided into 3 equal parts and 1 part is shaded.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-003 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A bakery made 36 cupcakes and packed them equally into 4 boxes. How many cupcakes are in each box?

content_zh.stem: A bakery made 36 cupcakes and packed them equally into 4 boxes. How many cupcakes are in each box?

questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-102 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math
questions.explanation_en: When the numerators are the same, the fraction with the smaller denominator is larger. Since 3 < 6, we have 1/3 > 1/6.
questions.explanation_zh: When the numerators are the same, the fraction with the smaller denominator is larger. Since 3 < 6, we have 1/3 > 1/6.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math
questions.explanation_en: To round to the nearest hundred, look at the tens digit. The tens digit is 6, which is 5 or more, so round up. 467 rounds to 500.
questions.explanation_zh: To round to the nearest hundred, look at the tens digit. The tens digit is 6, which is 5 or more, so round up. 467 rounds to 500.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-104 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A movie starts at 2:15 PM and ends at 4:00 PM. How long is the movie?

content_zh.stem: A movie starts at 2:15 PM and ends at 4:00 PM. How long is the movie?

questions.explanation_en: From 2:15 PM to 4:00 PM: 2:15 to 3:15 is 1 hour, then 3:15 to 4:00 is 45 minutes. Total: 1 hour 45 minutes.
questions.explanation_zh: From 2:15 PM to 4:00 PM: 2:15 to 3:15 is 1 hour, then 3:15 to 4:00 is 45 minutes. Total: 1 hour 45 minutes.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-105 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Scientists studying climate change measured a rectangular field that is 9 meters long and 4 meters wide. What is the area of the field?

content_zh.stem: Scientists studying climate change measured a rectangular field that is 9 meters long and 4 meters wide. What is the area of the field?

questions.explanation_en: Area of a rectangle = length × width = 9 × 4 = 36 square meters.
questions.explanation_zh: Area of a rectangle = length × width = 9 × 4 = 36 square meters.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-106 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A square garden has sides of 6 feet each. What is the perimeter of the garden?

content_zh.stem: A square garden has sides of 6 feet each. What is the perimeter of the garden?

questions.explanation_en: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side = 4 × 6 = 24 feet.
questions.explanation_zh: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side = 4 × 6 = 24 feet.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A line plot shows how many books students read in a week: 1 book (3 students), 2 books (5 students), 3 books (4 students), 4 books (2 students). How many students read exactly 2 books?

content_zh.stem: A line plot shows how many books students read in a week: 1 book (3 students), 2 books (5 students), 3 books (4 students), 4 books (2 students). How many students read exactly 2 books?

questions.explanation_en: According to the line plot, 5 students read exactly 2 books.
questions.explanation_zh: According to the line plot, 5 students read exactly 2 books.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: An AI company's server room has 6 rows of computers with 9 computers in each row. How many computers are there in all?

content_zh.stem: An AI company's server room has 6 rows of computers with 9 computers in each row. How many computers are there in all?

questions.explanation_en: 6 rows × 9 computers per row = 54 computers in total.
questions.explanation_zh: 6 rows × 9 computers per row = 54 computers in total.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-109 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Where does the fraction 3/4 fall on a number line between 0 and 1?
options: B. Exactly at the halfway point

content_zh.stem: Where does the fraction 3/4 fall on a number line between 0 and 1?
options: B. Exactly at the halfway point

questions.explanation_en: 3/4 = 0.75, which is past the halfway point (1/2 = 0.50) and closer to 1.
questions.explanation_zh: 3/4 = 0.75, which is past the halfway point (1/2 = 0.50) and closer to 1.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G3-MATH-110 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)
